ownedComment.body:
IXS

Register 6 curves based on peak fit
ownedComment.name: <Unnamed Comment>

ownedComment.body:
HXN

Nanodiffraction: Reconstruct 3-D reciprocal space

CHX/CSX

Reconstruct reciprocal space
ownedComment.name: <Unnamed Comment>

ownedComment.body:
HXN

From Gabe Iltis's notes 6-25-14:

Nanodiffraction: Convert to Q. Diffraction data needs to be transferred from real space, such as CCD image, to reciprocal space. Lattice parameter and strain information can be extracted accordingly.

CXSX/CHX

Convert a series of 2-D images to reciprocal space (h, k, l, intensity) from a 6-circle diffractometer
ownedComment.name: <Unnamed Comment>

publish:property.name: Body
publish:property.publish:value:
HXN

From Gabe Iltis's notes 6-25-14:

Nanodiffraction: Convert to Q. Diffraction data needs to be transferred from real space, such as CCD image, to reciprocal space. Lattice parameter and strain information can be extracted accordingly.

CXSX/CHX

Convert a series of 2-D images to reciprocal space (h, k, l, intensity) from a 6-circle diffractometer

ownedComment.body:
HXN

From Gabe's notes for HXN 6-25-14

X-ray Absorption Near Edge Structure (XANES) analysis needs to be enabled to decompose the measured spectra into reference oxidation states.

High dimension analysis can be involved, such as position-energy-Intensity or position-energy-time-intensity for XANES/spectroscopy.

SRX

XANES2: Collect images (raster sample) then change energy to tune across edge
ownedComment.name: <Unnamed Comment>

publish:property.name: Body
publish:property.publish:value:

High dimension analysis can be involved, such as position-energy-Intensity or position-energy-time-intensity for XANES/spectroscopy.

SRX

XANES2: Collect images (raster sample) then change energy to tune across edge

ownedComment.body:
XPD

2D -> 1D Azimuthal integration
ownedComment.name: <Unnamed Comment>

ownedComment.body:
XPD

2D -> 1D via Caking
ownedComment.name: <Unnamed Comment>

ownedComment.body:
Image algebra consists of simple operations to images: multiply, divide, add, subtract

It is almost certain that all of these operations will be handled by numpy

IXS

  1. Sum 6 experimental spectra

  2. Subtract elastic peak from summed spectra

CHX/CSX

Sum multiple images to increase signal/noise and dynamic range

XPD

  1. Simple mathematical operations on 2D images (subtract image N to image M, multiply by a scale factor)

  2. Sum a series of 2D images (in-place)
ownedComment.name: <Unnamed Comment>

publish:property.name: Body
publish:property.publish:value:
Image algebra consists of simple operations to images: multiply, divide, add, subtract

It is almost certain that all of these operations will be handled by numpy

IXS

  1. Sum 6 experimental spectra

  2. Subtract elastic peak from summed spectra

CHX/CSX

Sum multiple images to increase signal/noise and dynamic range

XPD

  1. Simple mathematical operations on 2D images (subtract image N to image M, multiply by a scale factor)

  2. Sum a series of 2D images (in-place)

ownedComment.body:
Image corrections consist of:

  1. Point Distortions

  2. Flat Field Correction

  3. Grid Correction

CHX/CSX

  1. Dark current subtraction

  2. Flat field correction
ownedComment.name: <Unnamed Comment>

publish:property.name: Body
publish:property.publish:value:
Image corrections consist of:

  1. Point Distortions

  2. Flat Field Correction

  3. Grid Correction

CHX/CSX

  1. Dark current subtraction

  2. Flat field correction

ownedComment.body:
Masking consists of getting rid of:

dead pixels

saturated pixels

thresholding

removing the beam stop

removing the beam stop holder

removing dead scintillators

(email me to add more that i haven't listed)

CHX/CSX

Remove bad pixels from 2D images

Remove beam stop and holder from 2D images

ownedComment.body:
HXN

Tomography with self-absorption correction:

• An automatic alignment method needs to be developed for both vertical and horizontal directions.
ownedComment.name: <Unnamed Comment>

publish:property.name: Body
publish:property.publish:value:
HXN

Tomography with self-absorption correction:

• An automatic alignment method needs to be developed for both vertical and horizontal directions.

ownedComment.body:
HXN

From Gabe Iltis's notes for HXN: 6-25-14

This method can be applied to data from different techniques, such as XRF, DPC, diffraction, ptychography, TXM, SEM and so on. For instance, general image overlay and correlation includes overlay density from DPC to composition from XRF and strain map from nanodiffraction/Bragg Ptychography.
ownedComment.name: <Unnamed Comment>
